Description: Upper part of a standing granodiorite statue of Sekhmet; solar disk on head broken at edges. Figure shown wearing a broad collar and close-fitting dress, and a bracelet on the right wrist. The left hand held a papyrus-sceptre in front of the body, but the arm and sceptre have been broken away. The right hand holds an ankh-sign. Lower legs missing. This figure may be distinguished by a patch of pink granite at the nose and another band of pink granite in the upper part of the solar disk.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: D. Antoine and M. Vandenbeusch, Egyptian mummies. Exploring ancient lives, Sydney 2016, p. 107.
